articles.title: OpenAI Releases gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, Open-Weight Language Models for Local Deployment
articles.description: OpenAI has released gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, two open-weight language models designed for high-performance reasoning, tool use, and efficient deployment. These are the company’s first fully open-weight language models since GPT-2, and are available under the permissive Apache 2.0 license. By Robert Krzaczyński
articles.author: Robert Krzaczyński
articles.content: OpenAI has released gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, two open-weight language models designed for high-performance reasoning, tool use, and efficient deployment. These are the company’s first fully open-weight language models since GPT-2, and are available under the permissive Apache 2.0 license. By Robert Krzaczyński

articles.title: AI Security Institute launches international coalition to safeguard AI development
articles.description: AI Security Institute joins forces with Canadian counterpart, Amazon, Anthropic and civil society in new research project focused on AI behaviour and control.
articles.content: AI Security Institute joins forces with Canadian counterpart, Amazon, Anthropic and civil society in new research project focused on AI behaviour and control.

articles.title: GPT OSS models from OpenAI are now available on SageMaker JumpStart
articles.description: Today, we are excited to announce the availability of Open AI’s new open weight GPT OSS models, gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, from OpenAI in Amazon SageMaker JumpStart. With this launch, you can now deploy OpenAI’s newest reasoning models to build, experiment, and responsibly scale your generative AI ideas on AWS. In this post, we demonstrate how to get started with these models on SageMaker JumpStart.
articles.author: Niithiyn Vijeaswaran
articles.content: Today, we are excited to announce the availability of Open AI’s new open weight GPT OSS models, gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, from OpenAI in Amazon SageMaker JumpStart. With this launch, you can now deploy OpenAI’s newest reasoning models to build, experiment, and responsibly scale your generative AI ideas on AWS. In this post, we demonstrate how to get started with these models on SageMaker JumpStart.

articles.title: NIH researchers develop AI agent that improves accuracy of gene set analysis by leveraging expert-curated databases
articles.description: The AI agent could help lead to a better understanding of how different diseases and conditions affect groups of genes individually and together.
articles.content: The AI agent could help lead to a better understanding of how different diseases and conditions affect groups of genes individually and together.

articles.title: Volt per meter (V/m)
articles.description: Volt per meter (V/m) is a crucial metric in the world of electromagnetism, representing how electric fields influence charged particles. Understanding this measurement not only helps clarify fundamental physical concepts but also plays an essential role in various applications, ranging from electrical engineering to telecommunications. What is volt per meter (V/m)? Volt per meter (V/m) […]

articles.title: OpenAI’s GPT-5 Announcement: What You Need to Know
articles.description: This post attempts to consolidate key details from OpenAI’s GPT-5 announcement alongside early reactions from users and industry observers. Presented in a question-and-answer format, it examines the model’s technical specifications, pricing structure, access tiers, safety enhancements, and validated enterprise use cases. The analysis also captures initial community responses, which range from praise for improved accuracyContinue reading "OpenAI’s GPT-5 Announcement: What You Need to Know" The...

articles.title: Building a Transformer Model for Language Translation
articles.description: This post is divided into six parts; they are: • Why Transformer is Better than Seq2Seq • Data Preparation and Tokenization • Design of a Transformer Model • Building the Transformer Model • Causal Mask and Padding Mask • Training and Evaluation Traditional seq2seq models with recurrent neural networks have two main limitations: • Sequential processing prevents parallelization • Limited ability to capture long-term dependencies since hidden states are overwritten whenever an element is...

articles.title: Understanding Prompt Injection: Risks, Methods, and Defense Measures
articles.description: Here’s something fun to start with: Open ChatGPT and type, “Use all the data you have about me and roast me. Don’t hold back.” The response you’ll get will probably be hilarious but maybe so personal that you’ll think twice before sharing it. This task must have elicited the power of large language models (LLMs)…

articles.title: AI Agents in Enterprise: A Journey Into AI-Generated Hell
articles.description: When I first got asked to build AI agents at my company, I thought most of my time would be about designing and coding the best agents possible. Instead, I got never-ending meetings, impossible expectations, and endless debates about workflow and organization.Two years later, with lots of AI agents and painful experience behind me, here are some learnings for you.Welcome to my journey through AI-generated hell.The Illusions of Rapid ProductsUsing all available frameworks (MCP, A2A, LangChain,...

articles.title: New NIST Reference Material to Strengthen Quality Control for Biological Drugs
articles.description: Impurities in these drugs can cause undesirable immune responses in patients and can significantly drive up costs for drug manufacturers.

articles.content: Impurities in these drugs can cause undesirable immune responses in patients and can significantly drive up costs for drug manufacturers.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5 for developers
articles.description: Introducing GPT-5 in our API platform—offering high reasoning performance, new controls for devs, and best-in-class results on real coding tasks.
articles.content: Introducing GPT-5 in our API platform—offering high reasoning performance, new controls for devs, and best-in-class results on real coding tasks.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5
articles.description: We are introducing GPT‑5, our best AI system yet. GPT‑5 is a significant leap in intelligence over all our previous models, featuring state-of-the-art performance across coding, math, writing, health, visual perception, and more.
articles.content: We are introducing GPT‑5, our best AI system yet. GPT‑5 is a significant leap in intelligence over all our previous models, featuring state-of-the-art performance across coding, math, writing, health, visual perception, and more.

articles.title: Prescriptive Agents based on Rag for Automated Maintenance (PARAM)
articles.description: arXiv:2508.04714v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Industrial machinery maintenance requires timely intervention to prevent catastrophic failures and optimize operational efficiency. This paper presents an integrated Large Language Model (LLM)-based intelligent system for prescriptive maintenance that extends beyond traditional anomaly detection to provide actionable maintenance recommendations. Building upon our prior LAMP framework for numerical data analysis, we develop a comprehensive solution...
articles.author: Chitranshu Harbola, Anupam Purwar
articles.content: arXiv:2508.04714v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Industrial machinery maintenance requires timely intervention to prevent catastrophic failures and optimize operational efficiency. This paper presents an integrated Large Language Model (LLM)-based intelligent system for prescriptive maintenance that extends beyond traditional anomaly detection to provide actionable maintenance recommendations. Building upon our prior LAMP framework for numerical data analysis, we develop a comprehensive solution...

articles.title: A Foundational Multi-Modal Model for Few-Shot Learning
articles.description: arXiv:2508.04746v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Few-shot learning (FSL) is a machine learning paradigm that aims to generalize models from a small number of labeled examples, typically fewer than 10 per class. FSL is particularly crucial in biomedical, environmental, materials, and mechanical sciences, where samples are limited and data collection is often prohibitively costly, time-consuming, or ethically constrained. In this study, we present an innovative approach to FSL by demonstrating...
articles.author: Pengtao Dang, Tingbo Guo, Sha Cao, Chi Zhang
articles.content: arXiv:2508.04746v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Few-shot learning (FSL) is a machine learning paradigm that aims to generalize models from a small number of labeled examples, typically fewer than 10 per class. FSL is particularly crucial in biomedical, environmental, materials, and mechanical sciences, where samples are limited and data collection is often prohibitively costly, time-consuming, or ethically constrained. articles.title: RetinexDual: Retinex-based Dual Nature Approach for Generalized Ultra-High-Definition Image Restoration
articles.description: arXiv:2508.04797v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Advancements in image sensing have elevated the importance of Ultra-High-Definition Image Restoration (UHD IR). Traditional methods, such as extreme downsampling or transformation from the spatial to the frequency domain, encounter significant drawbacks: downsampling induces irreversible information loss in UHD images, while our frequency analysis reveals that pure frequency-domain approaches are ineffective for spatially confined image artifacts,...
articles.author: Mohab Kishawy, Ali Abdellatif Hussein, Jun Chen
articles.content: arXiv:2508.04797v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Advancements in image sensing have elevated the importance of Ultra-High-Definition Image Restoration (UHD IR). Traditional methods, such as extreme downsampling or transformation from the spatial to the frequency domain, encounter significant drawbacks: downsampling induces irreversible information loss in UHD images, while our frequency analysis reveals that pure frequency-domain approaches are ineffective for spatially confined image artifacts,...

articles.title: RDDPM: Robust Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Model for Unsupervised Anomaly Segmentation
articles.description: arXiv:2508.02903v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Recent advancements in diffusion models have demonstrated significant success in unsupervised anomaly segmentation. For anomaly segmentation, these models are first trained on normal data; then, an anomalous image is noised to an intermediate step, and the normal image is reconstructed through backward diffusion. Unlike traditional statistical methods, diffusion models do not rely on specific assumptions about the data or target anomalies,...
articles.author: Mehrdad Moradi, Kamran Paynabar
articles.content: arXiv:2508.02903v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Recent advancements in diffusion models have demonstrated significant success in unsupervised anomaly segmentation. For anomaly segmentation, these models are first trained on normal data; then, an anomalous image is noised to an intermediate step, and the normal image is reconstructed through backward diffusion. Unlike traditional statistical methods, diffusion models do not rely on specific assumptions about the data or target anomalies,...

articles.title: GRAND: Graph Release with Assured Node Differential Privacy
articles.description: arXiv:2507.00402v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Differential privacy is a well-established framework for safeguarding sensitive information in data. While extensively applied across various domains, its application to network data -- particularly at the node level -- remains underexplored. Existing methods for node-level privacy either focus exclusively on query-based approaches, which restrict output to pre-specified network statistics, or fail to preserve key structural properties of the...
articles.author: Suqing Liu, Xuan Bi, Tianxi Li

While extensively applied across various domains, its application to network data -- particularly at the node level -- remains underexplored. Existing methods for node-level privacy either focus exclusively on query-based approaches, which restrict output to pre-specified network statistics, or fail to preserve key structural properties of the...

articles.title: MissMecha: An All-in-One Python Package for Studying Missing Data Mechanisms
articles.description: arXiv:2508.04740v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Incomplete data is a persistent challenge in real-world datasets, often governed by complex and unobservable missing mechanisms. Simulating missingness has become a standard approach for understanding its impact on learning and analysis. However, existing tools are fragmented, mechanism-limited, and typically focus only on numerical variables, overlooking the heterogeneous nature of real-world tabular data. We present MissMecha, an open-source...
articles.author: Youran Zhou, Mohamed Reda Bouadjenek, Sunil Aryal
articles.content: arXiv:2508.04740v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Incomplete data is a persistent challenge in real-world datasets, often governed by complex and unobservable missing mechanisms. Simulating missingness has become a standard approach for understanding its impact on learning and analysis. However, existing tools are fragmented, mechanism-limited, and typically focus only on numerical variables, overlooking the heterogeneous nature of real-world tabular data. We present MissMecha, an open-source...

articles.title: Uncertainty-aware Predict-Then-Optimize Framework for Equitable Post-Disaster Power Restoration
articles.description: arXiv:2508.04780v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The increasing frequency of extreme weather events, such as hurricanes, highlights the urgent need for efficient and equitable power system restoration. Many electricity providers make restoration decisions primarily based on the volume of power restoration requests from each region. However, our data-driven analysis reveals significant disparities in request submission volume, as disadvantaged communities tend to submit fewer restoration...
articles.author: Lin Jiang, Dahai Yu, Rongchao Xu, Tian Tang, Guang Wang
articles.content: arXiv:2508.04780v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The increasing frequency of extreme weather events, such as hurricanes, highlights the urgent need for efficient and equitable power system restoration. Many electricity providers make restoration decisions primarily based on the volume of power restoration requests from each region. However, our data-driven analysis reveals significant disparities in request submission volume, as disadvantaged communities tend to submit fewer restoration...

articles.title: High-Order Error Bounds for Markovian LSA with Richardson-Romberg Extrapolation
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05570v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we study the bias and high-order error bounds of the Linear Stochastic Approximation (LSA) algorithm with Polyak-Ruppert (PR) averaging under Markovian noise. We focus on the version of the algorithm with constant step size $\alpha$ and propose a novel decomposition of the bias via a linearization technique. We analyze the structure of the bias and show that the leading-order term is linear in $\alpha$ and cannot be eliminated by PR...
articles.author: Ilya Levin, Alexey Naumov, Sergey Samsonov
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05570v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we study the bias and high-order error bounds of the Linear Stochastic Approximation (LSA) algorithm with Polyak-Ruppert (PR) averaging under Markovian noise. We focus on the version of the algorithm with constant step size $\alpha$ and propose a novel decomposition of the bias via a linearization technique. We analyze the structure of the bias and show that the leading-order term is linear in $\alpha$ and cannot be eliminated by PR...

articles.title: RCUKF: Data-Driven Modeling Meets Bayesian Estimation
articles.description: arXiv:2508.04985v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Accurate modeling is crucial in many engineering and scientific applications, yet obtaining a reliable process model for complex systems is often challenging. To address this challenge, we propose a novel framework, reservoir computing with unscented Kalman filtering (RCUKF), which integrates data-driven modeling via reservoir computing (RC) with Bayesian estimation through the unscented Kalman filter (UKF). The RC component learns the nonlinear...
articles.author: Kumar Anurag, Kasra Azizi, Francesco Sorrentino, Wenbin Wan

To address this challenge, we propose a novel framework, reservoir computing with unscented Kalman filtering (RCUKF), which integrates data-driven modeling via reservoir computing (RC) with Bayesian estimation through the unscented Kalman filter (UKF).
